alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 14 at 5:54AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the U.S. Forest Service Sierra Avalanche Center. The Sierra Avalanche Center in Truckee has canceled a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: NWS Reno NV - NVZ002 (Greater Lake Tahoe)...CAZ072 (Greater Lake Tahoe (CA)) * WHAT...The avalanche warning previously issued to last until 6 pm Sunday has been canceled. The period of HIGH avalanche danger has ended. * WHERE...Central Sierra Nevada Mountains between Yuba Pass (Hwy 49) on the north and Ebbetts Pass (Hwy 4) on the south, including the greater Lake Tahoe area. This does not include ski areas and highways where avalanche mitigation programs exist. * WHEN...In effect from Sun 07:00 PST to Sun 18:00 PST. * IMPACTS...Conditions for creating a natural avalanche cycle in the backcountry over the past 24 hours have ended. Avalanches could still be triggered today by backcountry travelers. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Even though peak instability has passed, dangerous avalanche conditions may still exist in the backcountry today. Careful snowpack evaluation, cautious route-finding, and conservative decision-making are essential. Consult https://www.sierraavalanchecenter.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
